latest news.eng_title: Israel Continues to Bomb Gaza, 41,272 Palestinians Killed
latest news.summary: Israel has bombed two more homes in Gaza, including one in the ez-Zuhur neighborhood of Refah city, where two Palestinians were killed. This comes as part of ongoing attacks in Gaza, where 41,272 Palestinians have been killed, including 16,795 children and 11,378 women, and 95,551 injured since October 7. The Israeli military has also targeted hospitals and educational institutions, causing widespread destruction and leaving thousands of people trapped under the rubble. As reported by the Palestinian Civil Defense, six Palestinians were killed in the 'Huveyc' family home in Han Yunus city, and their bodies were recovered by rescue teams. Israel's attacks on Gaza have been ongoing, with the country's military targeting civilians and civilian infrastructure, including homes, hospitals, and schools.
latest news.title: İsrail, Gazze'de 2 evi daha bombaladı

latest news.eng_title: Israel's Ongoing Attacks on Gaza: A Humanitarian Crisis
latest news.summary: Since October 7, 2023, Israel has killed 84 civilian defense personnel in its attacks on the Gaza Strip. According to a statement from the Civil Defense Directorate in Gaza, Israeli forces targeted the home of civilian defense personnel Musab Abdullah el-Kürdi in the northern town of Beit Lahiya. El-Kürdi and his 7-month pregnant wife lost their lives in the Israeli attack. Civil defense teams in Gaza are playing a crucial role in the humanitarian crisis caused by Israel's attacks. Despite limited equipment and resources, they are working to rescue people from the rubble of bombed buildings and provide medical assistance. Since October 7, 2023, Israel's attacks on Gaza have resulted in the deaths of at least 41,272 Palestinians, including 16,795 children and 11,378 women, and the injury of 95,551 people.
latest news.title: İsrail Gazze katliamında dur durak tanımıyor.

latest news.eng_title: Gaza Reports 20 Palestinian Deaths in Israeli Attacks
latest news.summary: The Gaza Ministry of Health reported that at least 20 Palestinians were killed in a day due to Israeli Army attacks, according to TASS. Since October 7, 2023, a total of 41,272 people have been killed, and 95,551 have been injured. On September 18, at least 54 Palestinians were injured in the attacks. The situation on the Middle East has escalated after the October 7, 2023, incursion of Hamas militants from the Gaza Strip into Israeli territory, resulting in the killings of residents of border towns and the kidnapping of civilians. In response, Israel launched a military operation in Gaza to destroy Hamas' military and political structures and free all hostages, said the Ministry of Health. 'The situation is extremely tense and unpredictable,' said the Ministry. 'We urge all parties to exercise restraint and seek a peaceful resolution to the conflict.'
latest news.title: В Газе заявили о гибели 20 палестинцев за сутки

latest news.eng_title: Israel's Attacks on Gaza: 34 Palestinians, Including 9 Children, Killed in Past 24 Hours
latest news.summary: According to Mahmud Basal, the spokesperson for the Civil Defense in Gaza, Israel's recent attacks have resulted in the deaths of 34 Palestinians, including 9 children, in the past 24 hours. This brings the total number of Palestinians killed by Israel since October 7 to 41,272, including 16,795 children and 11,378 women. Additionally, 95,551 people have been injured. Basal stated, 'The number of people under the rubble is in the thousands, and hospitals and educational institutions, which are the refuge of the people, are being targeted and destroyed.'
latest news.title: İşgalci İsrail son 24 saatte 9'u çocuk 34 kişiyi şehit etti

latest news.eng_title: Israel's Ongoing Attacks on Gaza: 34 Palestinians Killed in Past 24 Hours
latest news.summary: The Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip, which has been under siege since October 7, 2023, continue to escalate. In the past 24 hours, 34 Palestinians, including 9 children, were killed. According to Mahmoud Basal, the spokesperson for the Civil Defense Directorate in Gaza, 'The Israeli attacks have resulted in the deaths of 34 Palestinians, including 9 children, in the past 24 hours.' Since October 7, 2023, Israeli attacks have killed at least 41,272 Palestinians, including 16,795 children and 11,378 women, and injured 95,551 people. The rubble of destroyed buildings still holds thousands of bodies, and hospitals and educational institutions, which are used as shelters by the public, are being targeted and destroyed. 'The Israeli attacks are targeting civilians and destroying the civilian infrastructure,' Basal said. 'The situation in Gaza is catastrophic, and the international community must take action to stop these attacks and provide humanitarian aid to the people of Gaza.'
latest news.title: İsrail'den Gazze'ye saldırı: 24 saatte 9'u çocuk 34 kişi öldü

latest news.eng_title: The World Under Siege: Israel's Brutal Attacks on Gaza and Lebanon
latest news.summary: The world is undergoing a severe test as it faces the brutal and inhumane attacks of 'the Land of Evil', a term used to describe Israel. Since October 7, 2023, Israel has been carrying out a genocide against Palestinians in Gaza, disregarding all rules, laws, and international human rights. The recent attacks on Lebanon, including the use of explosives in call boxes and radios, have resulted in the deaths of 21 people, including healthcare workers and children, and over 2,800 injuries. The Israeli government, which is said to be guided by a satanic ideology, continues to escalate its terrorism in the region, targeting Hizbullah in Lebanon. The situation is becoming increasingly tense, with no signs of a ceasefire. The world is holding its breath as it waits to see what will happen next. The Israeli government, which is supported by the US, seems to be unstoppable, and its actions are becoming more and more inhumane. As one writer noted, 'They are not just a terrorist state, but a state of terror.' The world is watching in horror as Israel continues its attacks, and it seems that there is no end in sight. As the writer said, 'They will stop at nothing, not even a world war.' The goal of the Zionists and evangelists is to bring about the apocalypse, and it seems that they are on the right path. The world is on the brink of chaos, and it is unclear what the future holds.
latest news.title: Dünya "Kötülükler Ülkesi"nin saldırısı altında...

latest news.eng_title: Israel's Attacks on Gaza: 34 Palestinians Killed, Including 9 Children, in Past 24 Hours
latest news.summary: In the past 24 hours, Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip have resulted in the deaths of 34 Palestinians, including 9 children. According to Mahmoud Basal, the spokesperson for the Civil Defense in Gaza, 'The ongoing Israeli attacks have caused the deaths of 34 Palestinians, including 9 children, in the past 24 hours.' Since October 7, 2023, Israel's attacks on the Gaza Strip have killed at least 41,272 Palestinians, including 16,795 children and 11,378 women, and injured 95,551 people. The rubble of destroyed buildings still holds thousands of bodies, and hospitals and educational institutions, which are used as shelters by the public, are being targeted and destroyed.
latest news.title: İsrail Saldırıları: Son 24 Saatte 34 Filistinli Hayatını Kaybetti

latest news.eng_title: Israeli Strikes in Gaza: 20 Dead, 54 Injured in Last 24 Hours
latest news.summary: The Ministry of Health in Gaza reported that Israeli forces have carried out two deadly attacks on families within the Gaza Strip in the past 24 hours, resulting in 20 fatalities and 54 injuries. Many victims remain trapped under rubble or stranded on roads, with emergency crews unable to reach them due to the intensity of the attacks. Since the escalation of hostilities on October 7, the death toll has soared to 41,272, with the number of wounded climbing to 95,551, according to the ministry's daily report, marking the 348th day of the aggression.
latest news.title: Israeli Strikes in Gaza: 20 Dead, 54 Injured in Last 24 Hours - Jordan News

latest news.eng_title: Israel Bombs Gaza School, Claims it was Hamas Command Center
latest news.summary: Israel has carried out a new bombing against a school in the Shujaia neighborhood of Gaza, which is home to displaced Palestinians, as part of its ongoing offensive against the enclave. The bombing, which has left eight victims, was launched against what Israel describes as a 'command and control center' of Hamas, according to a statement by the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF). 'The command and control center was used by Hamas terrorists to plan and carry out terrorist operations against the IDF and the State of Israel,' they said, adding that they took steps to 'reduce' the number of civilian casualties, amidst denunciations of the high number of civilian casualties and the massive destruction caused by their attacks. The IDF has stated that 'the terrorist organization Hamas systematically violates international law and brutally uses civilian institutions and the population as human shields.' 'The IDF will continue to act with force and determination against terrorist organizations,' they concluded. Israel launched a brutal offensive against the Gaza Strip in response to the attacks on October 7, 2023, which resulted in over 1,200 deaths and nearly 250 abductions. Since then, Gazan authorities have registered the deaths of over 41,250 Palestinians, in addition to over 700 in the West Bank and East Jerusalem in actions by security forces and attacks by Israeli settlers.
latest news.title: Israel bombardea una escuela en el norte de Gaza y afirma que era usada por Hamás como "centro de mando"

latest news.eng_title: Erdogan Warns of Israel's 'Dangerous' Maneuvers in Region
latest news.summary: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan expressed his condolences to Lebanese Prime Minister Najib Mikati over the recent explosions in Lebanon, stating that Israel's attempts to expand the conflict in the region are 'dangerous.' Erdogan emphasized that Turkey is working to put an end to the conflict. The explosions, which occurred on Tuesday, killed at least nine people, including a child, and injured many others. The Hezbollah group has confirmed that two of its members were killed and many others were injured in the blasts. The group holds Israel entirely responsible for the incident and has threatened 'just and unexpected reprisals.' The explosions took place in the context of cross-border attacks between Hezbollah and Israel, as well as Israel's ongoing offensive against the Gaza Strip, which has killed over 41,200 people, mainly women and children, since October 7, 2023.
latest news.title: Erdogan : Les manœuvres d'Israël visant à étendre le conflit dans la région sont dangereuses

news knowledge.eng_title: Israeli Soldier Stabbed, Perpetrator Killed in Jerusalem Attack
news knowledge.summary: According to Israeli media, a border police officer was lightly injured in a stabbing attack near the Bab al-Amud in Jerusalem. The perpetrator of the attack was reportedly killed after Israeli soldiers opened fire on him. Al Jazeera correspondent reported that Israeli police closed the gates of the Al-Aqsa Mosque and all the gates of the Old City in Jerusalem following the attack, and forced shopkeepers to close their stores in the Old City. This attack comes amid a surge in attacks on Palestinian citizens and their properties in the West Bank, including Jerusalem, by the Israeli army and settlers, since the outbreak of the war on the Gaza Strip in October 2023. The war has resulted in the deaths of hundreds and injuries of thousands of Palestinians. With US support, Israel has been waging a devastating war on the Gaza Strip since October 7, 2023, leaving over 136,000 Palestinian martyrs and wounded, mostly children and women, and more than 10,000 missing, amidst massive destruction and a deadly famine.
news knowledge.title: طعن جندي إسرائيلي واستشهاد المنفذ في القدس

news knowledge.eng_title: Israel's Escalation in the West Bank: A Growing Humanitarian Crisis

Organization: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

news knowledge.summary: Since October 7, 2023, the Israeli military has conducted near-daily raids on towns and cities across the West Bank, resulting in the deaths of over 582 Palestinians and the arrest of over 10,000 others. According to Middle East Eye, the number of raids has increased by more than three times since the start of the war on Gaza. The majority of these raids target refugee camps, which Israel considers to be strongholds of armed groups such as Jenin and Nur Shams. For example, on October 19, 2023, Israeli forces besieged Nur Shams, demolished its infrastructure, and killed 7 Palestinians. A week later, a deadly raid on Jenin and its refugee camp resulted in the deaths of at least 11 people. In December 2023, Israeli forces launched a 15-hour raid on Tulkarm, killing 7 Palestinians, and in April 2024, they launched a 3-day raid on Jenin refugee camp, killing 14 Palestinians and injuring dozens. According to Middle East Eye, the Israeli military has killed 582 Palestinians in the West Bank since October 7, 2023, while the Palestinian Ministry of Health estimates the number to be 652. The UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs estimates that 120 Palestinians have been killed by settler attacks. The number of Palestinians killed in the West Bank has increased since the start of the war on Gaza, with 9100 Palestinians added to the 5200 already in Israeli prisons. The nature of Palestinian arrests has become more violent, with reports of Israeli forces demolishing homes, attacking and threatening families, and subjecting detainees to inhumane conditions in Israeli prisons. According to the Prisoners' Club, 10 Palestinian prisoners from the West Bank have died in detention before the end of March 2024. Israel has used its war on Gaza as a cover for a dangerous escalation in land confiscation in the West Bank, with the Israeli military and settlers destroying 1429 buildings and displacing 3244 Palestinians, according to the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs. The Israeli government has approved the establishment of 5 new Israeli settlements, and the settler attacks have increased, leading to the displacement of Palestinian herding communities in the South Hebron Hills, Wadi al-Ghrous, and East Jerusalem. According to the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs, there have been approximately 1250 settler attacks on Palestinians, resulting in the deaths of 120 people, from October 7, 2023, to August 12, 2024. The West Bank has seen a significant increase in settler violence over the past few years, with the Israeli governments providing open support to the right-wing extremist groups. However, these attacks have intensified and received increased government support since October 2023.
news knowledge.title: ماذا تفعل إسرائيل في الضفة الغربية منذ 7 أكتوبر؟

news knowledge.eng_title: Israeli Occupation Forces Kill 11 Palestinians in Ongoing Attack on West Bank
news knowledge.summary: The Palestinian Ministry of Health reported that a 35-year-old man, Faras Bassam Al-Ra'iqat, was killed by Israeli occupation forces in Jenin during the ongoing attack on the northern West Bank. This brings the total number of martyrs since Wednesday to 11, with most being killed in drone strikes, in addition to 20 injured. Since October 7, 2023, the number of martyrs in the West Bank has risen to 663, with approximately 5,600 injured. The human rights organization Amnesty International condemned the Israeli occupation's attack on the West Bank, warning of the 'escalating deadly and unjustified violence' by Israeli forces. The organization stated that 'Israel's coordinated large-scale military attack on cities and towns across the occupied West Bank comes after a surge in unlawful killings by its forces in recent months, and will put more Palestinians at risk.' Since October 2023, there has been a 'shocking increase' in the use of deadly force by Israeli forces and violent attacks by settlers, backed by the Israeli government, in the West Bank, including East Jerusalem, resulting in the killing of at least 622 Palestinians, including 142 children. Amnesty International emphasized that the ongoing military operations on this scale will inevitably lead to an escalation of deadly violence, resulting in more Palestinian casualties. The organization also predicted that these operations will lead to an increase in forced displacement, destruction of vital infrastructure, and collective punishment, which were the cornerstones of Israel's apartheid system against Palestinians and the illegal occupation of Palestinian territories. Amnesty International called on the Israeli occupation to take measures to protect healthcare facilities and workers, citing reports of Israeli forces besieging hospitals and preventing access to them. The organization added: 'In addition, it must ensure that individuals in need of medical support are able to access the care they need. As the occupying power, Israel is clearly obligated to protect Palestinians, their homes, and infrastructure throughout the occupied Palestinian territories.'
news knowledge.title: شهيد برصاص الاحتلال في جنين والعدوان يتواصل على الضفة ...

news knowledge.eng_title: Israel army says 'failed' to stop deadly West Bank settler attack
news knowledge.summary: The Israeli military has admitted to 'failing' to stop a deadly settler attack in the occupied West Bank on August 15. According to Major General Avi Bluth, the attack was 'a very serious terror incident' in which Israelis set out to harm residents of the village of Jit. The military's investigation found that the first troops at the scene did not fully gauge the situation and needed to act more decisively. The attack resulted in the death of 23-year-old Palestinian man Rashid Sada and the wounding of another Palestinian. The military statement said that troops acted assertively to disperse the assailants, but the shooting that killed Sada occurred before more forces arrived. The case will not be closed until the perpetrators are brought to justice, Bluth said. The incident is part of a larger trend of rising violence in the West Bank, with at least 637 Palestinians killed since October 7 and 19 Israelis killed in Palestinian attacks.
news knowledge.title: Israel army says 'failed' to stop deadly West Bank settler attack

news knowledge.eng_title: 'State-sponsored terrorism': West Bank settler violence continues unabated
news knowledge.summary: As Gaza ceasefire talks continue in Qatar, deadly Israeli settler violence persists in the occupied West Bank and East Jerusalem. Since October 7, 2023, Israeli forces and settlers have deliberately started 273 fires targeting Palestinian land and property, according to the Wall and Settlement Resistance Commission. Mouayad Shaban, head of the commission, called it 'state-sponsored terrorism', aiming to terrorise civilians, destroy property, and force large-scale displacement. On Thursday, over 100 illegal Israeli settlers attacked a Palestinian town in the occupied West Bank, killing one person and setting fire to a home and several vehicles. The White House condemned the attacks, stating that 'attacks by violent settlers against Palestinian civilians in the West Bank are unacceptable and must stop.' The Palestinian resistance group Hamas also condemned the attacks. Since October 7, settler violence has led to 18 Palestinian deaths, over 785 injuries, and the displacement of 26 Bedouin communities.
news knowledge.title: 'State-sponsored terrorism': West Bank settler violence continues unabated

news knowledge.summary: At least 11 children and young people died in a rocket attack on a football field in the Golan Heights, occupied by Israel. The Israeli army blamed Hezbollah, a Lebanese group backed by Iran, for the attack, but Hezbollah denied responsibility. The attack occurred after an Israeli attack in Lebanon that killed four militants. The Israeli army said it was the deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since October 7, when Hamas killed over 1,200 people in southern Israel and kidnapped around 250. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Hezbollah would pay a 'high price' for the attack and that Israel would not leave it without a response. President Isaac Herzog said the terrorists 'brutally killed children who were only playing football. They never returned'. The attack has caused widespread destruction and many injuries.
news knowledge.title: Israel sufre el ataque más mortífero desde el inicio de la guerra

news knowledge.eng_title: Deadly attack on football field in Golan Heights claims 12 lives
news knowledge.summary: At least 12 people, including children, died in multiple rocket attacks in Israeli-controlled Golan Heights on Saturday, July 27. Israel has blamed Hezbollah for the attack, which included a soccer field where children and teenagers were playing at the time of the attack. The Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) spokesperson, Daniel Hagari, described the attack as 'the deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since October 7, 2023' and warned that Israel will act accordingly. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office stated that he was 'shocked' by the attack and vowed that Hezbollah will pay a heavy price for it.
news knowledge.title: Deadly attack on football field in Golan Heights claims 12 lives

news knowledge.eng_title: Deadly airstrike in Golan threatens harsh Israeli payback
news knowledge.summary: A rocket attack in the Golan Heights has killed 11 children and injured over 20 others, sparking concerns of a rapid escalation of fighting between Israel and Hezbollah. The Israel Defense Forces attribute the attack, which struck the Druze village of Majdal Shams, to Hezbollah, backed by Iran. This is the deadliest attack on Israeli civilians since the start of the war in the Gaza Strip in October 2024.
news knowledge.title: Deadly airstrike in Golan threatens harsh Israeli payback

news knowledge.eng_title: Deadly Attack from Lebanon Kills 11 Children in Israel
news knowledge.summary: At least 11 people, mostly children and teenagers, have died after a projectile fired from Lebanon hit the city of Majdal Shams in the Golan Heights, northern Israel, according to medical sources. The attack is the deadliest since the start of the war in Gaza, with over a dozen children killed. The projectile also left around 30 injured, six in critical condition, 10 with light injuries, and several with anxiety symptoms. 'This is the deadliest attack against Israeli civilians since October 7', said a spokesperson for the Israeli army. The Hizbulah group, which has powerful rockets, has been accused of carrying out the attack. The Israeli government has condemned the attack and is considering a response. The situation is escalating tensions between Israel and Lebanon.
news knowledge.title: Ataque mortífero desde el Líbano deja 11 niños muertos en Israel

news knowledge.eng_title: Netanyahu: 'Hizbulá will pay a high price' after death of 11 children in Israel
news knowledge.summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warned that the Lebanese militia 'Hizbulá will pay a high price' after the death of 11 children who were killed on Saturday by a projectile that hit a football field in the city of Majdal Shams in the Golan Heights, fired from Lebanon. Netanyahu made this statement to the head of the Druze community in Israel, Muafak Tarif. The attack is considered the most deadly against Israeli civilians since October 7, 2024. The Israeli Army spokesperson, Daniel Hagari, reiterated that Hizbulá is responsible for the attack, despite the group denying it. The incident has escalated tensions on the border between Israel and Lebanon, where there has been a daily exchange of fire since October 8, 2024.
news knowledge.title: Netanyahu, tras la muerte de 11 niños en el norte Israel: "Hizbulá pagará un alto precio"
